bug.author: Eric-Zhang1990
bug.summary: Error: "Sorry, /jupyter/ is not a valid page"
bug.description: Anyone can give any solutions for the problem "Sorry, /jupyter/ is not a valid page" ? Thanks in advance.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.74. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Eric-Zhang1990>@Eric-Zhang1990</denchmark-link> , could you provide some more info regarding your Kubeflow installation? How did you deploy kubeflow?

Based on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3414>#3414</denchmark-link> It looks like the URLs should be /notebook. Are you using an old version of Kubeflow? Where are you seeing this error? i.e. how would we reproduce it?

Having the same issue. None of the links in the menu bar work for me. I am accessing the UI by port-forwarding svc/centraldashboard: kubectl port-forward svc/centraldashboard -n kubeflow 8888:80. Perhaps I am missing some step here? kfctl version: 0.6.1 [go version] Cluster: AWS EKS automatically created by kfctl kfctl config derived from this: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/bootstrap/config/kfctl_aws_cognito.yaml>config</denchmark-link>

Same problem here. kfctl version: 0.6.2 kubeflow is deployed with <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6.2/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6.2/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml</denchmark-link>

I met the same problem. It seems you should not use kubectl port-forward to access the Kubeflow UI. Follow the instructions instead. For my case its: <denchmark-link:https://istio.io/docs/tasks/traffic-management/ingress/ingress-control/>https://istio.io/docs/tasks/traffic-management/ingress/ingress-control/</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link>
You should access the UI through the IngressGateway. Use kubectl -n istio-system describe svc istio-ingressgateway to find the right address and port. "http2" is the right port number.
